<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 648, 92]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the stretching of a spring.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 880, 153]]<|/det|>
Carry out the following instructions, referring to Fig. 1.1 and Fig. 1.2. Do **not** move the large load that is on the bench. At the start of the experiment, the spring should not be attached to the forcemeter.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 160, 875, 495]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[235, 507, 304, 526]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[567, 507, 636, 526]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 537, 144, 556]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 537, 185, 556]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 537, 660, 558]]<|/det|>
Measure the **unstretched** length \(l_0\) of the spring, in mm.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 567, 875, 588]]<|/det|>
<form>\(l_0 =\) .................................................... $mm$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 599, 180, 618]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 599, 680, 618]]<|/det|>
On **Fig. 1.1**, mark clearly the distance you have measured.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 631, 180, 650]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 630, 875, 666]]<|/det|>
Attach the spring to the forcemeter, as shown in Fig. 1.2. The load must remain on the bench.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 677, 183, 696]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 677, 875, 696]]<|/det|>
Gently raise the forcemeter until it reads 1.0 N. Clamp the forcemeter in this position.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 707, 875, 742]]<|/det|>
Record the forcemeter reading \(F\) in Table 1.1. Measure, and record in the table, the new length \(l\) of the spring.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 755, 181, 774]]<|/det|>
<label>(v)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 755, 875, 789]]<|/det|>
Calculate the extension \(e\) of the spring using the equation \(e = (l - l_0)\). Record the value of \(e\) in the table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 73, 180, 92]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 72, 816, 92]]<|/det|> Repeat steps (iv) and (v) using forcemeter readings of 2.0N, 3.0N, 4.0N and <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 87, 584, 106]]<|/det|> Record all the readings and results in the table. <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 119, 520, 137]]<|/det|> Table 1.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[258, 151, 695, 303]]<|/det|>
F/Nl/mme/mm

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 732, 92]]<|/det|>
